title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: Transforming Healthcare Document Processing Workflows with Generative AI

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this session demonstrates AWS’s GenAI Intelligent Document Processing (GenAIIDP) solution for healthcare, combining Amazon Textract and Bedrock to turn days-long manual document workflows into automated processes that complete in minutes. It covers automated classification, data extraction, criteria validation, HIPAA compliance, and includes live demos and architecture deep-dives with implementation, integration, and ROI best practices.
bullets: Combines Amazon Textract and Bedrock for generative-AI-driven document processing
Automates classification, data extraction, and criteria validation for complex medical documents
Transforms manual, days-long workflows into minutes-long automated pipelines
Designed with HIPAA compliance in mind
Includes live demonstrations, architecture deep-dives, and implementation/integration guidance
takeaways: Scalability: guidance on building scalable document-processing pipelines suitable for large healthcare workloads
Integration: patterns for connecting GenAIIDP with existing systems to minimize disruption
Operations & ROI: best practices to optimize throughput and justify investment in automation
Compliance: built-in HIPAA considerations reduce regulatory risk during adoption
Bottleneck elimination: automation can dramatically shorten processing timelines and free up staff

items.title: TTEC accelerates AI deployment and revenue streams with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description…TTEC partnered with Google Cloud Consulting to rapidly prototype and deploy GenAI solutions, unlocking new revenue streams while streamlining operations and boosting developer productivity. Sreeni Alakappan, VP of App Development and Automation at TTEC, credits Google Cloud's robust infrastructure and consulting support with compressing their digital transformation timeline and expanding what’s possible for the business.
bullets: TTEC worked with Google Cloud Consulting to accelerate AI prototyping and deployment.
GenAI plus Google Cloud infrastructure helped streamline operations and increase developer productivity.
The engagement unlocked entirely new revenue streams for TTEC.
Google Cloud Consulting compressed TTEC's digital transformation timeline.
Partnership expanded the company’s ambitions for what’s possible.
takeaways: Consider engaging cloud consulting to shorten AI deployment timelines and de-risk transformation efforts.
Evaluate cloud infrastructure capabilities that support GenAI to improve developer productivity and operational efficiency.
Use rapid prototyping as a path to validate AI-driven revenue opportunities before full-scale rollout.
Factor professional services and cloud platform robustness into digital transformation planning and budgets.

items.title: Year-end toolkit: Strengthening audit committee collaboration

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this episode of PwC’s Year-end toolkit focuses on strengthening collaboration between finance management and the audit committee and streamlining year-end accounting and reporting. It covers preparedness for key year-end issues and emerging oversight areas including AI, enterprise risk management, cyber risk in the age of AI, and enhancing proxy disclosures.
bullets: Strengthening management/audit committee communication and collaboration
Key year-end accounting and reporting issues finance teams should be ready to address
Oversight of AI: risks, opportunities, and necessary controls
Enhancing enterprise risk oversight and navigating evolving cyber risk in the AI era
Elevating proxy disclosures and broader governance reporting
takeaways: Engage audit committees early and clearly to streamline year-end reporting and governance reviews
Be prepared to explain AI use, associated risks, and control frameworks to those charged with governance
Integrate AI-related cyber considerations into enterprise risk management and resilience planning
Ensure transformation initiatives and year-end disclosures (including proxy materials) transparently reflect governance and risk oversight

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, route planning is made easy as Jo discovers the power of Copilot Groups. The short clip highlights Copilot Groups within Microsoft Copilot and positions it as a tool for simplifying route planning.
bullets: Focuses on route planning made easy.
Centers on a user named Jo discovering Copilot Groups.
Showcases Copilot Groups as part of Microsoft Copilot.
Presented as a brief demonstration or promotional clip.
Includes hashtags: #copilot #microsoftcopilot #ai
takeaways: Microsoft Copilot includes a feature called Copilot Groups that is presented for route planning.
Decision-makers coordinating field teams or logistics should note Copilot Groups as a capability to evaluate.
The content positions Copilot Groups as a potential tool for simplifying planning workflows in operational contexts.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… AI in audit is presented as a current, practical reality that helps audit teams handle repetitive tasks, analyze large datasets and make better decisions. In the KPMG ON AIR podcast, Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska outline concrete tools (AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI, KPMG Clara), client benefits, the shift from sampling to full-population analysis, and implementation challenges including data security and regulation.
bullets: AI Transaction Scoring Tool enables analysis of entire populations instead of sampling.
Clara AI provides conversational assistance and specialized agents to support auditors.
KPMG Clara platform offers real-time audit management and Clara for Clients improves client communication.
AI supports documentation and disclosure analysis, changing the auditor’s role and required competencies.
Key challenges noted: implementation/adaptation, data security, regulatory environment and potential AI-related risks.
takeaways: Expect more comprehensive audit coverage (full-population analysis) that can reduce sampling risk for critical infrastructure audits.
Real-time audit platforms and client-facing tools can improve transparency and speed of remediation for grid/data center issues.
Prioritize data security and regulatory compliance when sharing operational data with AI-enabled audit tools.
Invest in staff skills around AI tools and data analytics to engage effectively with modern audit processes.
Plan for operational changes as audits shift from sample-based checks to continuous, data-driven assurance.
